conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the setup and path of the light.
The image shows a semi-cylindrical transparent object with axis OA and point C at distance \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R\) from O.
The light ray enters the semi-cylindrical object along the axis OA.
The light is refracted to point C, which is at a distance \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R\) from O.
The angle of incidence at point O is \(\theta_1\), and the angle of refraction at point C is \(\theta_2\).
Since the light ray is not emitted from the right side, it is totally internally reflected at point C.
The critical angle \(\theta_c\) for total internal reflection is given by \(\sin \theta_c = \frac{n_2}{n_1}\).
The angle \(\theta_1\) is calculated using the geometry of the semi-circle: \(\sin \theta_1 = \frac{R}{R} = 1\).
The angle \(\theta_2\) is calculated using the geometry of the triangle: \(\sin \theta_2 = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}\).
Using the critical angle condition, \(\sin \theta_c = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}\), we find \(n_1 = \frac{1}{\sin \theta_c} = \sqrt{3}\).
The refractive index of the transparent object is \(\sqrt{3}\).
